com.googlecode.jaks.archive.resource

Class UnixModeGuesser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.jaks.archive.resource.UnixModeGuesser

  • public class UnixModeGuesser
extends Object
    "Guess" an appropriate Unix mode (permissions) for a resource or folder.

    For archiving, we can't depend on the actual permissions set on a file since we may be building on a non-Unix OS. This class makes a best guess at the permissions that should be on a folder or resource, which is usually good enough for an archive.

    The base implementation uses UnixStat.DEFAULT_DIR_PERM for folders and UnixStat.DEFAULT_FILE_PERM for files. If the file looks like a shell script, it is marked as executable. You can override the default implementation to handle more complex scenarios.

    Author:
    Jason Smith

      • getFirstLine

        protected String getFirstLine(AbstractResource resource)
                       throws IOException
        Get the first line from the resource, treating it as US-ASCII text (so no encoding errors, ever). This is intended to be used to snoop for shell scripts.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource.
        Returns:
        The first line of the resource.
        Throws:
        IOException
